intro: Boehmeria ramiflora var. subvelutina, commonly known as the velvet flax or silky flax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the荨麻科 (Urticaceae) family, characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a distinctive velvety texture due to dense pubescence. The flowers are small and greenish-white, clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in textile production.
